data.event: The land was part of Shepardsfield Plantation (also called Bog Brook Plantation), granted on March 8, 1777 by the Massachusetts General Court to Alexander Shepard, Jr. of Newton, Massachusetts.
On March 6, 1792, the plantation was incorporated as Hebron, with Oxford its southwesterly portion.
First settled in 1794, Oxford was set off and incorporated on February 27, 1829.
First settled in 1794, Oxford was set off and incorporated on February 27, 1829.
It annexed land from Otisfield in 1830, and Paris in 1838.

event.title: a grisly murder that, to this day

data.event: This was also the site of a grisly murder that, to this day, goes unsolved.
